statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 5 \\ 5 \\ -2 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 5 \\ 2 \\ 3 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 15 \\ 9 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 10 \\ 6 \\ -4 \\ 6 \\ 6 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 5 \\ -6 \\ 2 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 5 \\ 5 \\ -2 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 5 \\ 2 \\ 3 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 15 \\ 9 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 10 \\ 6 \\ -4 \\ 6 \\ 6 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 5 \\ -6 \\ 2 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
